Above is the format of while statement loop in C#.
Condition is any expression that returns a Boolean result â€“ true or false. It determines how long the loop body will be repeated and is called the loop condition.

In the above example, three things are important. 
1. Initialization
Initialization represents the starting position from there your loop will be started. In the above example int i=0 refers to initialization of while loop.
2. Increment/Decrement
i++ refers to increment/decrement
while(i<10) refers to the termination of while loop. Each time the while loop executed, it checks for condition whether the value of i is less than 10 or not.
f the value of i is less than 10, the loop will be executed and increment i by one and then print the value of i
3. Termination.
 When the value of i reaches 10, the while(i<10) condition becomes false and terminates the loop.
